00126 /*==============================================================================
00127  *
00128  * Function:
00129  *      nfs4_op_lookupp - The NFS4_OP_LOOKUPP operation
00130  *
00131  * Synopsis:
00132  *   int nfs4_op_lookupp(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00133  *                         compound_data_t   * data,
00134  *                         struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00135  *
00136  * Description:
00137  *      This functions handles the NFS4_OP_LOOKUPP operation in NFSv4. This function can be called only from nfs4_Compound
00138  *
00139  * Other Inputs:
00140  *
00141  * Outputs:
00142  *
00143   * Interfaces:
00144  *
00145  * Resources Used:
00146  *      memory
00147  *
00148  * Limitations:
00149  *
00150  * Assumptions:
00151  *  Notes:
00152  *
00153  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00154 
00155 
00168 #define arg_LOOKUPP4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookupp
00169 #define res_LOOKUPP4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplookupp
00170 
00171 int nfs4_op_lookupp(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00172                       compound_data_t   * data,
00173                       struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00174 {
00175   fsal_name_t            name ;
00176   cache_entry_t        * dir_pentry = NULL ;
00177   cache_entry_t        * file_pentry = NULL ;
00178   fsal_attrib_list_t     attrlookup ;
00179   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status ;
00180   int                    error = 0 ;
00181   fsal_handle_t        * pfsal_handle = NULL ;
00182 
00183   char                   funcname[] = "nfs4_op_lookupp" ;
00184 
00185   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_LOOKUPP ;
00186   resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplookupp.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
00187 
00188   /* If there is no FH */
00189   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00190     {
00191       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00192       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00193     }
00194   
00195   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00196   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00197     {
00198       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00199       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00200      }
00201   
00202   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00203   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00204     {
00205       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00206       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00207     }
00208 
00209   /* looking up for parent directory from ROOTFH return NFS4ERR_NOENT (RFC3530, page 166) */
00210   if( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len == data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_len && memcmp( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val, data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_val, data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ) == 0 )
00211     {
00212       /* Nothing to do, just reply with success */
00213       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_NOENT ;
00214       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00215   }
00216 
00217   /* If in pseudoFS, proceed with pseudoFS specific functions */
00218   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00219     return nfs4_op_lookupp_pseudo( op, data, resp ) ;
00220 
00221   /* If data->exportp is null, a junction from pseudo fs was traversed, credp and exportp have to be updated */
00222   if( data->pexport == NULL )
00223     {
00224       if( ( error = nfs4_SetCompoundExport( data ) ) != NFS4_OK )
00225         {
00226           res_LOOKUPP4.status = error ;
00227           return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00228         }
00229     }
00230 
00231   /* Preparying for cache_inode_lookup ".." */
00232   file_pentry = NULL;
00233   dir_pentry = data->current_entry ;
00234   name = FSAL_DOT_DOT ;
00235   
00236   
00237   /* BUGAZOMEU: Faire la gestion des cross junction traverse */
00238   if( ( file_pentry = cache_inode_lookup( dir_pentry, 
00239                                           &name, 
00240                                           &attrlookup, 
00241                                           data->ht,
00242                                           data->pclient,
00243                                           data->pcontext, 
00244                                           &cache_status ) ) != NULL )
00245     {
00246       /* Extract the fsal attributes from the cache inode pentry */
00247       pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( file_pentry, &cache_status )  ;
00248       if( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00249         {
00250           res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00251           return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00252         }
00253 
00254       /* Convert it to a file handle */
00255       if( !nfs4_FSALToFhandle( &data->currentFH, pfsal_handle, data ) )
00256         {
00257           res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00258           return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00259         }
00260 
00261       /* Copy this to the mounted on FH (if no junction is traversed */
00262       memcpy( (char *)(data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val), 
00263               (char *)(data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val), data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ) ;
00264       data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ;
00265       
00266       /* Keep the pointer within the compound data */
00267       data->current_entry = file_pentry ;
00268       data->current_filetype = file_pentry->internal_md.type ;
00269       
00270       /* Return successfully */ 
00271       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00272       return NFS4_OK ;
00273       
00274     }
00275  
00276    /* If the part of the code is reached, then something wrong occured in the lookup process, status is not HPSS_E_NOERROR 
00277    * and contains the code for the error */
00278   
00279   res_LOOKUPP4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00280 
00281   return res_LOOKUPP4.status;
00282 } /* nfs4_op_lookupp */
00283 
00284 
00295 void nfs4_op_lookupp_Free( LOOKUPP4res * resp )
00296 {
00297   /* Nothing to be done */
00298   return ;
00299 } /* nfs4_op_lookupp_Free */
